intro: Orthosiphon usambarensis, commonly known as African tea or usambarensis, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and riverbanks. The leaves are used in traditional medicine for their diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
